intro: Corydalis pallida f. ramosissima, commonly known as the pale corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers bloom in early to mid-summer. This subspecies is noted for its delicate appearance and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens.
